column4: Anyone know how to recover unfinalized mini-DVD's from a camcorder using the "dd" command?
Anyone?
http://www.ubuntugeek.com/recover-data-from-a-damaged-hard-disk-using-dd_rhelp.html
if the escape code shows up in xev then yes
the keyboard is modeled after the old Northgate Omnikey 101 except it has 12 extra function keys
but  I need to know before I buy a $185 keyboard, that linux can support 24 function keys
what do you mean by "escape code"
you may need a bios upgrade
possible
you can use partimage to make an image then spit it onto a bigger partition, or you can use dd to write the data bit by bit from source to destination
its an open nvidia driver
does ubuntu 10.04 try and install that by default?
its part of a default install along with the other tonne of drivers it comes with
is the mouse ok in other systems? Try a different port
in windows this mouse works fine on the same box,  and I've tried on 4 ports already
if you are using an external usb hub. Try without the hub
no hubs
syslogs, messages don't go crazy or anything while plugged in, but I do see adverse effects in gnome
try in keyboard shortcuts
the left click on my mouse is sharing the same key as the usb mic answer/call end button.  Keyboard shortcuts won't help
boot to live cd and reinstate grub2
by reinstate, do you mean update-grub?
you need to chroot first
